intro: Cyathula lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by leaf-like bracts. It is typically found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats. Cyathula lancifolia is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties remain under study.
